page.title: 02IDEFORD
page.content: Ideford is a nucleated village with a present population of 308.It is smaller in size than in 1801 when it was an important farming community.Now it is mainly a village occupied by people who commute to nearby centres of employment such as Newton Abbot and Exeter.The village has experienced some recent growth, with the building of a small group of modern detached and semi detached houses.These are at the south east end.Older buildings dating back 200-300 years are found along the main street of the village and grouped around the Church,while at the western end there is a small area of postwar council housing.The village supports a very small range of shops probably because of competition from nearby villages like Chudleigh,and towns like Newton.
